review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: The lobby is beautiful. The rooms a bit outdated for the price cost.

review.title: Great hotel when flying out of SFO.
review.reviewText: We stay at this hotel when we have an early flight out of SFO. The shuttle service is great.

review.title: L. C Nice and clean
review.reviewText: Very pleasant.  I enjoyed my stay. checking and check out was very easy
review.locationRemarks: easy airport access

review.title: Easy in and out
review.reviewText: A friend and I only stayed for an evening but service was great and hotel was clean.  Would go again if needed to be at the SFO airport but kinda far if you are wanting to explore San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel just next to the airport
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Fishermans Wharf is only 15 min drive. The front desk lady Terry was so helpfull and very nice to us. The waitress at the restaurant on tge other hand wasn't so nice. She was rude and it looked like she didn't wanted to be there. The breakfast food was great but the service needs improvement. The rooms were clean, the elevator has a feature that only guest can use it. Is very safe. Overall the hotel is great exept for the service at the restaurant. I will give it a 9 out of 10. I will go back to that hotel exept I will go eat somewhere else.

review.title: Good stay!
review.reviewText: The room was very nice and spacious, and the surrounding rooms were relatively quiet. There was a great big table that was good for my children to work on. The bathroom was clean. We had a very comfortable stay before we flew home.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean. Rooms are spacious. Nice place to eat on ground floor.
review.locationRemarks: It's near the airport, for those who want to stay near.

review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful, when I was having credit card problems

review.title: Comfortable stay near airport
review.reviewText: Easy drive to downtown SFO without breaking the bank. I just didn't like that for its price it didn't include breakfast.

My experience at this hotel was great! Good location with a great restaurant right next to it. My room was clean and nice. The view over the mountains was unforgettable! So overall The Holiday Inn was the perfect stay!!!
The experience was great! Inexpensive with great qualities.

review.title: A welcome rest
review.reviewText: We checked in late and while there was a line, they took care of us quickly. The beds were superb and it is very close to the airport. We took the shuttle to out flight and were on time.
Hotel was very clean, and comfortable, good area close to the more important San Francisco attractions.

First off when paying at front desk she told me $100 deposit and she charged $200 to my card then no one told me that I needed the key to use the elevator then room service did not come clean the room and restock towels never make the bed are empty the garbage I had to call for them to come to empty the garbage and ask for towels
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing really and since you're paying that much for the hotel you should not have to pay for parking in the parking lot
review.negativeRemarks: They need to prove on customer service room service cleaning in guest should not have to pay for parking because they are already paying for the room
review.locationRemarks: It's okay

review.title: Nice hotel but not the location
review.reviewText: I was really nice hotel, good staff, just everything was a distant especially if you touring around San Francisco than is a 30 minute drive to downtown San Francisco

We were alarmed to find several cars were broken into during our stay. More lighting is needed throughout the entire parking areas. The room
was great n comfortable . Elevator needs working on. When checking in the FD agent needed to focus on the guest checking in n not have a side conversation
It was nice and cozy, on par with a 3 star hotel. It was convinient for me to stay here and take a cab to downtown SF.

Disappointed, overall. After getting into room, AC not cooling. Maintenance came to room, said not to use thermostat on wall, only use unit thermostat. Cooled for about 1/2 hour, then did not cool rest of night.
Only 1 wash rag in bathroom.
Did not expect a fee to park car IN the hotel parking lot.

review.title: Ok good service
review.reviewText: Ok had a good service and facilities of a 3-stat hotel
I thought the hotel was adequate. I was disappointed I had to pay a parking fee on top of the hotel fees. It should have been more clear when I was comparing costs between hotels.

review.title: High Security Hotel
review.reviewText: Elevators don't operate without keycards. So you don't find other than guests in the upper floors.

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText:
1. Housekeeping knocked on our door several times at 10am even with 'DO NOT DISTURB SIGN' on the door. While I was on my way to open the door, they were already using their keys to open our door. Complained about it, was promised complimentary parking but we were still charged with parking.

2. Asked for 30 mins late check out, front desk lady did not allow us.

review.title: Close to airport. Good bar and restaurant
review.reviewText: Bar has good atmosphere.  Nice service.  Only bad thing is the bar design.  Lights on the bar make it hard to see the customer and feel right in your face.

review.title: Good for a night
review.reviewText: Everything was fine but front desk lady with attitude! Probably cause Late night shift?

review.title: Nice to stay close to airport
review.reviewText: This is the 10th we stay at the hotel. Stil fell good as the first and will pick to stay next time for sure.
Very nice hotel...very unhappy about the $10.00 per night paking fee!

review.title: Needs updating.
review.reviewText: Expensive for the quality.Nice staff. Good food and service restaurant for breakfast
review.positiveRemarks: Client was staying there too. Comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Looks shabby... caulking repair a mess in bathroom; chipped furniture. Not much hot water (and hot and cold water opposite of notation on fixture.

review.title: Good location but...
review.reviewText: My biggest frustration with the hotel was the handle for the shower. It was almost impossible to adjust the water to hot or warm. The handles for the shower need to be replaced for ordinary, easy to use handles. Also the windows to the street were so dirty, I had to cover up the windows. Other than that the hotel was nice and located next to the freeway. Very close to the freeway and near a few restaurants. The staff was pretty nice also.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the handles for the showers for some that are easier to use.
review.locationRemarks: I went to ihop across the street and there is a Dennys I think. I also drove to Target and bought some nice shampoo.

review.title: Across from S SF conference center
review.reviewText: Wanted something near conference center with a restaurant and bar. This place is perfect if that's what your looking for

review.title: Rude staff at Starbucks inside the casino
review.reviewText:
This was my third stay at this hotel because it's near my work place in Commerce industrial area. On each visit, I found the group of employees at the Starbucks inside the casino as un-caring, rude and  obnoxious.. it did not matter who was serving... They all behaved the same way.. 
Check them out and let me know your comments.

review.title: Nice hotel close to where we had to meet otherd
review.reviewText: The people at the front desk were extremely helpful finding places and printing out directions. For this we were very grateful. The room was in excellent shape. Only wish we had real glasses to sip our wine and some more shampoo and soap but all in all it was perfect for the two of us.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Close to town, easy to get to from freeway, good price, staff professional and very nice. Spacious room

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Upon checking in, hotel manager was not friendly. Our hotel phone didn't work, told front desk about and no one never came to fix it. Bartender at the Houlihan's restaurant was not friendly as all.

review.title: Noce hotel closed to the airport
review.reviewText: Great area with easy access to highways anda few good restaurants in the area
Hotel was comfortable, and clean. Only real negative thing was the fitness center was small and in disrepair.

review.title: Close to the airport with a bar downstairs
review.reviewText: For a 3 start hotel it was very good. I ordered room service and they were fast. Maybe they need to add more to they're menu like a salmon dish.

review.title: More than I expected
review.reviewText: Good hotel and great price. It was far from SF but it was worth it. Very clean and the rooms where really great. The guide at the TV is horrible but is acceptable.

review.title: Nice room and location.
review.reviewText: I was a little disappointed that when making my reservations that I would be charged to park my car.  Also, breakfast was stopped to early for Saturday and Sunday.

review.title: Last minute stay
review.reviewText:
We were looking for a room to stay in after seeing a play in downtown San Francisco. Everything in the heart of the city was overpriced, including the parking. We came across this hotel online & they had reasonable pricing for the area, & parking was $10, as opposed to the $60 average parking price in the main city. It was a short drive from the main part of the city to the hotel.

The negative thing I do have to say about this stay, was that our room wasn't fully cleaned. The beds seemed cleaned & made, but there were hairs on the bathroom counter, & the carpeted floors weren't vacuumed. There were white strings, hairs & a woman's painted, clipped fingernail on the carpet near the bed. It disgusted me, & I kindly let the front desk know about it the next morning while checking out. I had told them that I wasn't sure if the vacuum was broken, or if housekeeping missed vacuuming & finishing cleaning that particular room. They didn't seem too concerned about it. Other than this issue, it wasn't a bad last minute stay.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the blackout drapes for being able to get much needed rest in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Just making sure that the rooms get cleaned thoroughly.

review.title: Transition  Hotel
review.reviewText: Overnight before returning home, very close from airport so no traffic to get there
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough restaurant around, in the industrial park
review.locationRemarks: Not much, MC Donald near, that's about it, if not take the car

review.title: Dirty and dangerous
review.reviewText: I'm expecting a 100% refund. I had to run from this place. Dirty beds, walls paint peeling off, iron will damage your clothes. The worst part, the bad attitude of the personnel.
facilities are dated, room was not as clean as it could be
Good 3 stars hotel, the wifi not working good ,hallway little dirty.

review.title: Old but renovated hotel
review.reviewText: Great staff. Good location. Old hotel. Not much amenities

review.title: Gross hotel
review.reviewText:
The lobby is the only nice part of this hotel. The rooms are very old and smell bad. Like old and smoky.
The bathrooms are scary and the people that stay here are even scarier. I did not feel safe at all and am glad we were here only for the night.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO and right off the highway.

review.title: Not a great value
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly, the hotel is a bit tired, dinner service at Houllahan's was slow and we we're served our appetizers at the same time as main course! Was not a great value but it is close to the airport and that was the main reason for our stay.

review.title: Convenient location to the airport.
review.reviewText: My sister and I were here for vacation and didn't have hotel reservations. We took a chance the first night and they got us in. The gentleman at the desk was very helpful. He recommended the restaurant located in the hotel and the stuffed chicken was amazing. After taking a trip to the wine country we decided once again to take a chance and return to the hotel another night. It was a little more expensive but once again the staff was professional and courteous. I would return to this hotel again.

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: A little slow getting signed in as one person was in training so the other kept having to assist making them both ineffective.  The staff was quite friendly and the hotel was very modern and updated.
review.negativeRemarks: didn't stay long enough to know
review.locationRemarks: Only stayed 10 hours and then off to the airport which was close by.

review.reviewText: Restaurant was great. Loved downtown San Francisco
Key cards didn't work at first, restaurant was excellent.

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: Hotel is fine. For the price point and not too far from city. Very few towels in room but they bring more to you quickly if you request. Floor needed vacuuming but otherwise clean and comfortable.

review.title: Easy peezy
review.reviewText: Check in and out was a breeze. Door got stuck and they fixed before I can blink. My hotel clerk was very helpful and easy to deal with
Room had good dark out curtains and good temperature control.  The bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Very convenient location near to the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is like others in the Holiday Inn hotel brand, I have my IHG regards club membership but I was not possible to accumulate points because I had booked from Expedia. The personnel at the reception desk seems not to be trained to welcome guests and I guess an android hotel receptionist would be able to provide a warmer welcome. They don't have parking space and there is the need to pay in addition for parking your rented vehicle.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is good just a few miles from airport and with close access to route 101. Travel from the hotel to downtown SF is just a 20 minutes ride.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel staff, specially at the reception desk needs an intensive training to improve treatment to customer

review.title: Expected better!
review.reviewText: There was only 1 towel and the toilet clogged. The bar tender was nice though.

review.title: Very basic hotel, but convenient to airport.
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and check-in was quick. The room was clan and quiet. It was perfect for one night.
I like the fact it had a security elevator that only ascess by room key.  Room was very clean, bed was comfortable.  I would book this place again.

review.title: Incorrect TV movies charges not reversed.
review.reviewText: Charge twice for same movie. Desk personnel would not remove the charge. Said it was the vendors issueWould not provide number to call.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: not much to say, i was there for work in the Bay area
review.locationRemarks: I dont know

review.title: Too ran down for the price
review.reviewText: I will never stay here again it wasn't clean didn't have enough towels the bed was ran down it was just not clean at all

review.title: room cleaning service
review.reviewText: I asked front desk to clean my room twice. She called the staff in my face to clean it but the staff never cleaned it. The people in the front desk is not so friendly.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: I almost always stay at Holiday Inns during my travels but this experience was very much disappointing.  I booked for two double beds for four people.  I checked in and was told by front desk that they are giving me one king size because that is all they have.  He told me that in their system, only two people are listed.  I showed my itinerary/confirmation with four people confirmed.  The front desk didn't seem to be very sorry at all.  I had to put my son on the floor for the night as I had my daughter on the roll away bed.  I am in San Francisco a lot but never had to stay on this hotel until this weekend.  Guaranteed, I never will and there is a reason why this hotel is rated only two stars.  Wish I had checked the reviews before but like I said, I usually trust Holiday Inns.  Lesson learned!

Decent size room, beds comfy, bathroom fine.
Heating didn't work at all and the room was cold. Found a spare blanket in the closet. (No, I didn't want to change rooms after I arrived late on a delayed flight and was already in bed, still freezing after turning the "heat" up.)
review.negativeRemarks:
Heating didn't work. 
Restaurant service great, my food quality scored 3/10

review.title: Outdated hotel
review.reviewText: The front desk staff had no clue what they were doing and they called my husband the wrong name over and over when he even had a name tag on??? The rooms are very outdated

review.title: Conveniently located close to SF Airport
review.reviewText: Standard comfort but no charm at all, nothing more. Good for a night of sleep, nothing more.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Very comfortable clean updated... Just one complaint please fill up the soda machines went to all floors and all sold out except the last floor finally had it... Over all I give it a 3.5 star very pleased

review.title: Front desk no help
review.reviewText: The older lady at the front desk has no personality and is no help.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk people need to explain things about the hotel to the guest

review.title: Nice Hotel, good restaurant and close to Airport
review.reviewText: good restaurant, close to airport and free shuttle, room clean
review.locationRemarks: good location near to Airport and mall

review.title: Only if desperate
review.reviewText: The lobby was the only clean part of the hotel. The room didn't look vacuumed. Sink was dirty. Shower didn't function correctly. There was blood on one of the pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: Stop focusing on the image of the lobby and focus on the quality of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Seriously, just in front of the airport, besides that there is no reason to stay here at all.

review.reviewText: We can hear the door open/close from your neighbor room. Overall t the location and place is good.

review.title: By far the worst experience ever
review.reviewText: Some one entered our room while asleep and stole my wallet and friends cash... when talkin to the manager all he kept stating is he stands by his staff which I never once blamed... will never go there again

review.title: Hotel was the right price for the weekend
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok for the price i paid. I stayed in a a king suite and the room was pretty big. I loved that the windows opened.
review.negativeRemarks: It could use some updating. The paint in the bathroom could use a touch up.

review.reviewText: So far the room is good and the only problems are the noise of the door from the other room was distributed

review.title: Had to pay for parking, there was NO PARKING!!
review.reviewText: Room wasn't ready on time for check in. Staff didn't care. Room was nice and big, bed was comfortable. No towel racks to hang towels. Parking was horrible. There was no spaces and a 10 fee for parking. Spaces were very narrow. My car ended up with a dent from the neighboring car!

review.title: Decent Hotel near to SFO Airport.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant.  Check In / Check Out was a breeze.  The room was clean and the amenities satisfactory.  For a business stay the hotel was fine.  There is a Houlihans connected to the hotel that made it convenient to grab a meal at night up to 11:00 PM that you could have added to your room bill.  All in all, this hotel is worth a passing grade.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the Airport; Courtesy shuttles run every 30 minutes back and forth up to about midnight; clean; professional service and stay was peaceful.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was acceptable; maybe the linens could be better quality but they were clean.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the Airport; easy to get to the BART which makes commuting around the area all right.

review.title: Good location, next to SFO airport.
review.reviewText: Been staying here for several years.  Great location for business travelers that need to travel throughout the valley.  Nice that they have a Houllihans attached.  Hotel is a step above a Days Inn/Red Roof Inn, but below a higher-end property.  The hotel is old and was remodeled and is starting to look it.  Rooms are big and appear clean for the most part, however the bathrooms aren't the nicest.  I've stayed in many different rooms all of the shower/toilet areas are a bit run-down.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel the shower/toilet portions of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Right near SFO airport.  Perfect location if you need to travel between downtown San Francisco and San Jose.

review.title: Holiday Inn south San Francisco. Horrible experien
review.reviewText: This hotel really need to see the cleanliness of everything including bathrooms. Staff were laying down in the hallway taking a break @4pm. Staff knock my door @8:20am trying to find out at what time I was leaving when check out is @noon so they could clean it. It was a really bad experience. Staff was asking how many days I was staying over. They charge for Parkig.  It doesn't have a pool and is not a cheap hotel so I expected at least 3 stars. I will never visit Holiday Inn anymore. Expedia should also shop them around once in a while in order for us to keep on using their services.
No pool, check in desk staff not as friendly like other Holliday INN I have stayed at.

review.title: Better than your average airport hotel.
review.reviewText: Stayed here one night to catch an early flight. I wasn't expecting or needing much beyond the convenience of being close to airport. The property, comfort of the room, amenities and service were a pleasant surprise and a much appreciated way to end a long business trip. Even the hotel restaurant had very decent food. Shuttle to the airport was frequent, efficient and free. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Hotel location was convenient. Check-in and check-out was quick and efficient. Included breakfast was good. Room lighting was poor and overall dcor is in need of an update. AC was a bit noisy but not awful. Bedding was average. Bathroom was clean and reasonably spacious. Hotel appeared to be under renovation. Windows must be paper thin as 3 a.m. trash pick-up was heard loud and clear. Felt like we paid about $50 more than the room was worth. All adds up to an average overall rating.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk staff, bathroom size, proximity to SFO and rental car return.
review.negativeRemarks: Room lighting and dcor needs updating. Restrict trash pick-up to after 8 a.m. at the earliest.
review.locationRemarks: Good proximity to SFO.

review.reviewText: The room was partially remodeled, along with the bathroom.

review.title: Other Holiday Inns
review.reviewText:
I had stayed at other Holiday Inns before this trip and I was more pleased with the other locations than this.  The whole hotel smelled like tobacco smoke and the room, lobby and restaurant was dark and depressing.  I think most of the cliente only spend one night before/after their flight from/to SFO so accommodations/comfort are not that important.
The restaurant is the proper setting for adults only because of the large screen TVs no separation between the bar and eating area.  Our wait staff was nice and was very sincere about giving good customer service.  
The room was dark and the walls were thin considering being near a busy airport.  It's not a place for families to spend summer vacation near or around San Francisco.  Our wardrobe was broken...the left door almost came off.  The shelving that covered the refrigerator was crooked and made opening the refrigerator difficult.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything:new carpets, drapery, bedding, decore.  Furniture(wardrobe, desk, under the bed coverings)need to be replaced, wall in the restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: The walk to IHOP was pretty safe considering the street was a multi-lane busy street.

review.reviewText: We got to our hotel and were unable to find any parking around the hotel that night. We were tired and hungry so we went to our room left luggage and went to restaurant in hotel which was packed.  Unable to get a table we ordered room service. They told me they could not bring it to our room because they were too busy. My husband picked up our food which one order was wrong and the food was not even warm. upon leaving the next morning I had noticed they had charged us for room service on our receipt. I went into restaurant to inform them so I could get our cash back since we had paid for our meal cash the night  before. I could not get any help. I got tired of Waiting and left. The restaurant was Houllihans. Disappointing!
Ok hotel. Dated & tired but fine for the price. Bathroom could have been cleaner.

review.title: Yellow stains on sheets!
review.reviewText: Yellow stains on sheets - that should say it all. Holes in curtains, discarded cups under the bed, and a bathroom the size of a telephone booth - these are just some of "features" of this hotel. It reminded me of a $50/night motel in Little Rock, Arkansas I stayed in a few years ago. Terrible. Take my advice and go elsewhere.

review.title: Nice hotel, comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: We spend the weekend nice experience. I want to received specials and continue to visit our hotel

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was nice, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The only issue I had is that the drapes did not keep light out efficiently. I had a hard time sleeping due to a gap in the drapes allowing light directly onto my face. Overall 4 out of 5 stars.
Shower was really gross. The bar brought in lower class people.

review.title: It is convenient staying here
review.reviewText: It is convenient staying this location of the Holiday Inn hotel. The only thing that I wouldn't be happy with is the parking fees ($10).
Last minute hotel booked for fourth of July weekend no complaint's

review.title: Uncomfortable stay
review.reviewText: The front desk lady was arrogant and the hotel air conditioner was not working the room was so hot that you could hardly sleep. we called the office and a repair man came and said he fixed the problem but there was no change
review.negativeRemarks: see  that the air conditioning works , and front desk people should be more courteous and helpful
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: bathroom lights goes off just like that
review.reviewText: bathroom lights just goes off on its own, its not very nice esp when you are in the shower or doing your make-up? I understand that we should conserve energy but this is way too much. The hotel wasn't cheap, were expecting better service for the money we pay. Also their restaurant service was poor. Saturday breakfast did not go well, servers were literally missing and nobody seemed to remember i ordered sausage with my sourdough french toast. They said it was coming but never did!
review.positiveRemarks: room service was a breeze, came earlier than expected, and the lady that brought it was very nice. Those calamaris were good !
review.locationRemarks: very near the airport, found a small nice restaurant that served authentic italian food.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: My daughter pulled the sheets back and there was hair in both beds!! Nasty!! Parking cost 10.00 a night to park at the hotel that to me was a rip off. Then at the resturant people were complaining about the food and service and I agree it was a totally horible experience and they did not even care!!

review.title: Poor transport
review.reviewText: Being at SFO for business meant I stayed local. Hotel was ok but shuttle never ran on time, waited at least 45minutes each of the 5 nights I stayed. Sometimes longer. Staff would just show schedule, not helpful. Also after an 8 hr trip to arrive finally at 01:10pm told no rooms or check in until after 3 pm. Will not stay again in Holiday Inn.

review.title: Needs update!
review.reviewText: Elevators are in bad need of cleaning and or updating. smelly room. Overall not recommended
review.negativeRemarks: update the entire building and lower the price. The cost per night is of a 5 stars!
review.locationRemarks: airport

review.reviewText: did not appreciate having to pay for parking on hotel grounds felt like gouageing

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: It felt small for 3 people. The furniture was outdated.
Toilet plugged and maintenance was called and toilet was still plugged. Had to notify desk when we checked out that problem was not resolved.
review.locationRemarks: Location was terrific being so close to San Francisco airport

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
I like this hotel .
You should choose the breakfast including plan when you make reservations.
the room was not clean and the house keeping didn't come to clean it , towels were smell bad
review.positiveRemarks: nothing that much , i thought this is one of the good hotels but i was disappointed
review.negativeRemarks: house keeping stuff should be trained and do their job in better manner

review.title: Toilet seat was broken and room smelled they asked
review.reviewText: Room stunk they switched my room from my Expedia booking I knew it was a bad idea room looked like old bad paint smelled bad broken toilet seat

review.title: Expensive parking.
review.reviewText: Bed and pillow are good.  Coffee cup are wet and has mold.  You can hear something like a jack hammer almost every hour from outside.

review.title: Hotel location was perfect for me
review.reviewText: When I arrived they informed me they needed my credit card for any future charges andvthat a $50.00 would be deducted right away! It was fine with me when the clerk said that money was going to be charged to my acct and if I was going to be ok without it! It was ok with me but the clerk kept on asking me if I was going to be ok without those $50 and I found it insulting. Thank God I can afford to pay a high class hotel like yours, great food to eat, a daughter attends SF State Univ, can please myself financial..., don't need to be humiliated like that. The clerk said my $ wouldn't be credited right away but if I needed it I could call to get credit right away! It made me very uncomfortable and still bothers me quite a bit!

Pretty poor hotel.  Had to pay $2.00 for a cup of coffee and pump it yourself.  Later that morning we
saw someone get it for free.  
Will not stay again.

Stay at a Hampton Inn!!!!

review.title: Little run down
review.reviewText: This hotel is a little run down. Even those it's just a quick sleep before catching my flight I would like toilet paper. An alarm clock is always helpful too. Sheets a little dirty. Staff not genuine.
Front desk was understaffed leading to some lines at checkin, but overall a great stay!

review.title: Good hotel. Will stay again
review.reviewText: Close to airport and not horribly expensive. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly. If your looking for 5 star luxury this isn't for you, however, if your like the rest of the world this place is perfect. Resturaunt in hotel is nice, good breakfast and dinner.

review.title: Reasonably priced airport hotel
review.reviewText: City centre hotels all booked due to big convention.  This hotel was comfortable with good transport links.  Very pleasant staff and regular shuttle to/from the airport.  I could then pick up a BART train or an airport shared ride pretty cheaply.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed.  Very nice staff.  Breakfast pretty nice.

review.title: No Internet
review.reviewText: Disappointed , no Internet , no start up breakfast

review.title: Nice location by the airport
review.reviewText: Although the plumbing can use a little tlc. The shower flow wasn't as great. And parking can fill up

review.title: Charging a parking fee because we book via Expedia
review.reviewText: I felt cheated. While parking is free for all guests, we were charged 11$ of parking because we book through Expedia instead of directly with the hotel chain. Really?
Not good. The room condition was bad. Ugly bathroom. Ugly and dirty lobby.

review.title: Not the Best.
review.reviewText: Bathroom too small, stuff coming out of the side of the shower head (hair, junk). One bed when you sit soomed in.  When housekeeper cleaned my room, still dirty bathroom and never cleaned around the faucet.  Even when I left her a tip $$ and a letter.

review.title: Nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText: We would definitely stay here again! Nice place, close to the Airport and everything you will need.

review.title: Needs renovation
review.reviewText: The hotel has a wonderful  staff but the hotel needs to be renovated. Beds are old and uncomfortable, faucets are stuck and hard to open. Definitely the hotel needs to make changes immediately!

review.title: very nice experience
review.reviewText: the Holiday Inn SFO (not Holiday Inn Express; don't get confused) was a very pleasant experience. A little airplane noise in the middle of the night but otherwise very positive experience culminating with the owner offering me a free cup of coffee and pastry from the gift shop after i checked out.  Houlihans restaurnat being attached is a big plus for convenience.  drinks are cheap and the food was a B+.

review.title: very nice place to stay near San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Not the first time we stay at this hotel, it's close to all the fun places in San Francisco.

review.title: Room clean and beds comfortable
review.reviewText: I stay at a lot of hotels and compared to my previous experiences, our room was clean and the beds comfortable with easy access to the highway and airport.  The hotel front staff were very friendly.  I booked the hotel in a hurry as we changed plans quickly and decided to go to San Francisco.  I am used to a pool, hot tub and a complimentary breakfast.  This hotel doesn't provide any of those.  The cost of parking per day is $10.95; $9.95 to park and $1.00 for tax.  The elevators need some "WD40" and a Craftman wrench.  Our A/C wouldn't go below 77 but they accomodated us and moved us to a much more comfortable room.  Overall for the money and comparing to other hotels in the area, this is a good deal.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff, beds and cleanliness of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Trash along the hallways on the 3rd and 4th levels.  Elevators sound like they are about to break.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the 101, airport, Fishermans' Wharf, Half Moon Bay, Muir Woods,

review.title: Close to San Francisco airport.
review.reviewText: This hotel was near the airport. The bed was comfortable but I was disappointed about the lack of cleanliness details in my room as well as some maintenance issues. I would've preferred to stay somewhere else.

review.title: Aging airport hotel
review.reviewText: The room itself was clean and acceptable.  However, the shower controls were old and did not work properly.  Parking was terrible, due to the presence of a popular chain restaurant/bar on site.  Htel guests pay $10 per day to park, but often there are no spaces available.  The worst thing, though, was that after a day away from my room, I returned late in the evening to find my door open.  The closure mechanism didn't work and housekeeping staff failed to pull the door shut after they cleaned the room.

review.title: San Fran trip 2015
review.reviewText: Hotel offers restaurant /bar that is convenient with lots of TVs.  Staff was very friendly.  Room was kept clean every day.  Cleaning staff was extremely helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff treated me very well
review.locationRemarks: Location was good for those that need a place close to the airport.  Hotel offers a shuttle to and from the airport which was convenient

review.reviewText: Pretty far from downtown, fishermas wharf or golden gate. Had to pay 10 dolar extra per night per parking.
I had a good stay, very comfortable. I will definitely stay here again, when I visit San francisco
I like the service that the staffs provided. Needs renovation on bathrooms.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Condition of the room is poor.  Bathroom is very outdated and tiny.  They turn off the AC at night to conserve energy.  I was told it was on a timer.  The room became very stuffy and hot during the night and I had to literally leave the room at 5AM to get fresh air.  I brought it to their attention the first night and it happened again the next night I was there.

review.title: Would not recommend this hotel.
review.reviewText: Complimentary shuttle is rarely on time. They claim to run every 10 and 40 minutes after the hour, but frequently found myself waiting well beyond the time frames given and had to call - then someone would show about 10 minutes later. The time it takes to get to the hotel. Broken ice machine on floor- said they would come fix, but didn't over 3 days. Unfriendly staff didn't bother to ask me how my stay was upon checkout.

2-the bed sheets they did not looked fresh, there was hairs. I was very disappointed with this hotel since other times at this hotel at other locations it was excellent.

San has great public transit   There was a nice restaurant bar on site but Denny's and IHOP close by. The only problem was the bathrooms a bit dated but worked. The bathtub drain a bit slow. Definitely would stay there again. Staff went out of their way to be accommodating from the front desk to housekeeping.

It was rather loud and unlike loud neighbors, I couldn't go downstairs and tell them to turn the music down. I would suggest the room I stayed in remain empty for when loud events are going on downstairs.

review.title: Over priced- bad staff
review.reviewText:
We stayed here just for overnight before a week vacation to Cabo. 
I booked with expedia, then called to confirm our two rooms. I requested two rooms both with double/queen beds . 5 travelers . I was charged an extra person fee of $10 for one if the rooms. I get the confirmation and see it has us down for two rooms with king beds. ( well you would think if I paid an extra fee for 3rd person in one room they'd note 3 people need at least two beds.) I called, the person cut me off mid sentence and said no problem, it will be taken care of. 
We get there and it wasnt they did not have another room and just said we'd get a roll away bed. I was not happy- but didn't have time to change hotels. The roll away was in bad condition and very uncomfortable for my young adult son. They charged parking of $9  a day while we were gone but here's an annoying thing they charged me parking for the night we stayed!! How ridiculous! I'm staying at your hotel! The staff member was just rude and I was very nice but did question why my reservation was not corrected and why pay for parking while I'm staying at the hotel. He ignored me. Poor service. I'll never book another holiday inn. They are terrible.

THE HOILDAY INN AND EXPEDIA SAID THEY WOULD NOT REFUND THE PRICE OF ROOMS NOT USE AFTER CHECKING OUT EARLY.  That would be 3 days. I'm but will never use holiday inns or expedia  unless I receive a refund for the 3 night that were not use on this trip

review.title: NOT for families- NO POOL
review.reviewText:
Last stop of a 10 day western tour. Room itself was fine. Other amenities not so much. Toiletries not replenished. Towels not replenished adequately and took over an hour to get enough towels for everyone to shower. Hotel staff gave terrible recommendation on how to get to AT&T park- $67 round-trip for an adult & 2 kids & took 1:45 to get there from hotel!! 
There is no pool. You have to use hotel key card to make elevators go up. Housekeeper said it was because we were in a 'sketchy' area. No free breakfast as appears on Expedia site- you get a $20 voucher for their restaurant. Worked ok first day but 2nd day said I owed $20 when ordered almost the same thing. They did make it right but was a bit of a hassle.

review.title: Probably wouldn't stay here again....
review.reviewText: Rooms were average.  Biggest complaint was getting linens.  We asked four times for extra wash cloths, as there was only one in the room - for 4 people.  They could not understand what a wash cloth was.  One person even said "the small ones?".  We got lots of towels and hand towels, but never did get any more than 3 wash cloths.  The air conditioning did not work properly either.

review.title: Equidistant between San Francisco & Silicon Valley
review.reviewText:
I chose this hotel because of price and convenient distance from the airport (easier to leave for an early a.m. flight at the end of my stay).  That's it.  Those were my qualifiers.

Upon staying at the hotel, I learned of many more benefits.  

Based on the treatment by the Front Desk staff, I felt as if my stay was up to me.  There was no harping on places to visit, options or 'try this or that.'  The Front Desk staff, were superb at multitasking, knowledgeable and gracious to all comers which I observed peripherally while on my way in and out.  

The physical space was clean, including my room.  The bed was comfortable.  The area spacious.  While there wasn't much of a view, and the neighborhood wasn't filled with entertaining things to do, I wasn't there for aesthetics.  There was a refrigerator in which I put food for the week.  And, for a guy who does all of his own ironing, the iron was a quality appliance.  One issue I did have was poor connectivity of wireless Internet.  It may have been free, but made me feel as if I was running 14.4 or 28.8 Kbps.  Otherwise, I liked my room.  

As for proximity, that was my first stay in the South San Francisco area.  I spent my time either up in the city proper, or down in the Silicon Valley area.  The hotel was ideally placed.  And, if that weren't enough, the hotel offered a free shuttle too and from SFO airport.  What a huge convenience.
review.positiveRemarks: The central proximity to San Francisco proper and Silicon Valley.
review.negativeRemarks: The connectivity of the WiFi was a downer.  It was slow or even ineffective.
review.locationRemarks: There is a Target located conveniently nearby, and the CalTrain is also within walking distance.  The free shuttle to SFO means accessibility to BART.

review.title: Not a bad place for a quick stopover!
review.reviewText: Reservations via Expedia is getting very comfortable, actually I think I am stuk with it.  The hotel was a quick stopover for a night.  Staff were nice and the location is awesome.  But, the parking awful when we had checked in.  Per an Expedia critiques, the bed needs to be replaced.  Too soft!  Also, in the morning the airplanes; not a hotel for sleeping in until the checkout.  But, for all in all purpose, at the price, the rooms were big and comfortable!  I would recommend for a quick stopover or a biz trips where you are only there to sleep only!  BTW, cool restaurant and bar at the lobby!

review.title: Don't expect much. Not and ounce of luxury
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a business trip with a bit of sight seeing added in. We were very disappointed in this hotel. The room is just OK, the bathroom, closet, and sink area is very small and cramped. The wallpaper was peeling in spots, the paint was sloppily applied, the air vent was dirty. The mini fridge was pretty useless, our beverages were cool at best. I ended up throwing out some milk because it was so warm I didn't trust it. The customer service sucks, the nicest people there were the two cleaning ladies that did our floor everyday. Our TV remote didn't work and it took 3 calls to the front desk over the span of an hr and a half before someone finally came up with a new one. Since we were on a business trip we had a lot of computer gear, and since there are no in room safes we declined maid service. A few days in I had to call for a fresh set of towels, we waited at least 45mins for someone to bring them. The #1 complaint is the free wifi they boast about. It is so bad my husband hardly got any work done. We wanted to connect our ChromeCast to the TV for the bigger screen but the wifi was so bad it wouldn't even transfer the stuff from the laptop to the TV. It's honestly good for...not much. The attached restaurant is inconsistent. We ordered the same appetizer on two different occasions because the first time it was delicious; the second time we ordered it it was soggy and the toppings were only on about 1/4 of the appetizer. Won't stay here again
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is nice, but unless you plan on staying in the lobby your whole trip it isn't gonna do ya much good. The parking situation was OK.
review.negativeRemarks: The free wifi. The TV. THE STAFF.

review.reviewText: It's just a Holiday Inn name. Nothing like Holiday Inn brand.

review.title: Very clean and comfortable airport hotel
review.reviewText: The room was clean and comfortable. The staff courteous, helpful and friendly. Houlihan's restaurant has great atmosphere, food and staff. I had a great time.
review.locationRemarks: It is an airport hotel, no sights nearby.

review.title: Great last minute stay :D
review.reviewText: the place was really nice and clean gave an instant comfy feeling as soon as stepping in through the door great safety services as far as how the elevator only works if you have a room key.

review.title: It was fair, but it can be better.
review.reviewText: Overall, it's okay. Better service! Better services!
review.locationRemarks: Close by airport.

review.title: Close to the airport and freeways
review.reviewText: I was very dissatisfied with the first room they gave me. The room was not clean properly, they did not vacuumed it, the bathroom smells dirty and the shower curtain had not been changed for days and it smelled dirty!!!! pillow cases and linen looked and smelled like they had not been changed. Very disgusting experience on that particular room. After that I was moved to a different room and it was much better. But just the whole first impression of the previous room, ruined my stay. The front desk Agent Estella was very helpful and attentive. She made me feel better.
review.positiveRemarks: The food and service at the restaurant

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: OK place to stay waiting for morning flight. Parking Fee ($10) is a little annoying. The hotel also requires a parking pass be put on the dashboard. Room was fine for a night.

review.title: Not Great, Not Bad, Not Good.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is not great, it's not bad and it's not really good. It's OK and will do.
Out of necessity I have stayed here twice. (In 3 different rooms). The AC does not really work, however they believe for N. California they don't need much AC.
The wireless internet is connected however your speed of download or connectivity sometimes feels like you are going backwards in time.
The room service is much slower than they tell you and it very expensive: like 2 eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast will be (including service fee, gratuity, and taxes): $18 - $26 depending our drink choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to the location of our meeting.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was great, and helpful rooms and comfortable and clean.

review.title: Convenient and Dependable
review.reviewText: Went for the weekend and had an early flight out on Monday morning. Great service and a timely wake up call, made this stay excellent. Food at the lobby restaurant was fair, with friendly bartender and company. All around a wise choice for my travel.
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: really nice and clean hotel
review.reviewText: I'd stay here again but with my families. I like the bar because it stays open late

review.title: Very nice hotel e
review.reviewText: Great room service , very nice staff, hotel located in the right place, not far from downtown, and the suround town thank.

review.title: Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: Close to airport, decent restaurant on property. Airportbus running every 30 minutes. Very nice drivers

review.title: Excellent Hotel Staff!!!!
review.reviewText: Staying here was a pleasant experience, Thanks again
review.locationRemarks: Didn't see anything other the the room.

review.title: Airport Hotel... as usual
review.reviewText:
I stayed 2 nigths. Reception people where helpfull. I ask for a change of the room and they do it without any problem.
Room 502: nosiy machine in the other side of the wall and impossible to get a shower without getting burn or cold.
Room 517: no problems with shower. Wheel of chair broken.

Average hotel with a lot of people coming in&out.
Everything is "used" and clean.
Restaurant quality very good. Above average.
Good shuttle bus to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: It looks old and dirty while it is not but It looks like!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the aiport.

review.title: Great hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: Bed was comfortable and staff was helpful. They gave me recommendations on how to ensure I got to my flight in the morning re: rental car return. I had a hurt back and they went out of their way to help me with my luggage at 4 am.

review.title: Close to airport with shuttle onsite restaurant
review.reviewText: Room was cool. Not much around for entertainment but the hotel shuttles to airport which is how you get to Bart station. Served its purpose for our 2 night stay.

review.title: Great hotel loved it!
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were great the room was great the only bad thing is being woken up at 3am because someone was trying to get into our room.

review.title: Rainy Olympic weekend
review.reviewText:
We were there during the Olympics and enjoyed being able to watch while eating at the hotel dining room. The fact that they had all the TV monitors was a main reason we chose the hotel. The first night we arrived late and had trouble connecting to the channel showing the Olympics. A service person was in our room immediately and fixed the problem.
It was a rainy weekend and a couple times they were mopping the stairs from the parking lot to the lobby so I appreciated their paying attention to the potential for someone to slip. Our room was clean and everything was nice quality, beds were great and the room was quiet.
My only complaint might be that I bought a bag of M&Ms from their little snack room and it cost $2.00. I was in a San Diego Hotel the next week and they were only $1.25. Can't complain though because the price per night at the Holiday Inn was an amazing deal.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: it's wonderful. the rooms are neat.
review.reviewText: If you check in earlier that they allowed. You can call them.they will help you to deal with this.

review.title: First time in the hotel
review.reviewText: It was interesting as I found out in SF the hotels charge you for parking your vehicle on their property even when you are a customer also the bath room fan did not work when in the bath room.
review.positiveRemarks: easy to get to from air port
review.negativeRemarks: need to monitor the bathroom fans and heating and cooling system for maintence
review.locationRemarks: easy to get to interstate with

review.title: Ok for a Holiday Inn
review.reviewText: The Hotel itself was decent for a Holiday Inn. The sheets were stained and the bathroom tiles were moldy, the toiletries were used. The front desk staff were horrible. They never answered the phones, they looked up my name for my reservation and couldn't find it. I told her I had a confirmation number but she wouldn't take it, she continued to search by name and finally the manager looked up my reservation number and found it, go figure. For the 350/night there are way better options in the area.

review.title: Average hotel with bad staff
review.reviewText: We got woken up in the morning by a call from front desk and then loud knocking on our door that turned out to be a misunderstanding on their part. I complained about the situation and they have done nothing about it.

review.title: Very clean and comfortable!
review.reviewText: I had a very short stay due to flight cancellations, but I was promptly picked up from the airport by the shuttle service, quickly checked in, and was in my room in no time. The staff were all very accommodating. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet & I slept well. Just what I needed after a grueling day at the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, comfortable, quiet and close to the airport. And they provided free airport shuttle service!!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, which is great for business travelers...I was there less than 12 hours, so I don't know what was around there, except Starbucks.

review.title: Comfortable stay near the airport.
review.reviewText: Great location. Comfortable. Friendly staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to the airport. Print boarding passes from lobby computer.
review.negativeRemarks: One of our room keys did not work. It was quickly remedied by the front desk personnel.

review.title: Good value for the location (and nothing fancy)
review.reviewText:
We have no complaints at all about this hotel. Other than check-in, which was quick and pleasant, we never needed to talk to the hotel staff. Our room was cozy, clean, and everything mostly worked just fine (the internet was REALLY slow).

Finding the right exit from the 101 proved to be hilariously difficult for us until our third attempt.

The location isn't particularly inspiring, as it's close to the airport, but it suited our needs perfectly. There is another Holiday Inn Express a few blocks south of this location, and we were confused about which one was ours, so keep an eye out for that when booking.
review.positiveRemarks: Since we needed to bounce between SF and Palo Alto on this trip, the location of this hotel was perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: This is an older property, so fixtures and paint could use a spruce; not dirty, just worn. And free wifi was so slow it was essentially unusable.

review.title: All good but pricey
review.reviewText: They were good, helped me with a toothbrush and toothpaste since I forgot mine but overall, it was pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, not so much to the city.

review.title: one night stand
review.reviewText: it was very good .had problem with t.v. and they were there to fix on the spot.
review.positiveRemarks: security with room keys and the elevator was a great idea
review.locationRemarks: not much to do .bar was good but noisy. close to airport was reason we stayed there

review.title: Stayed to visit a duck family in hospital close by
review.reviewText: Clean room as soon as u walked in, forgot to lack toothbrush and they supplied us without accepting tip in about 5 minutes

review.title: Not worth what I paid for.
review.reviewText: BEWARE OF EXTRA INCONVENIENT CHARGES THAT SHOULD BE FREE!!. I didn't realize you had to pay for 10.00 per night for parking and 15.00 for breakfast. For the rate I paid, I could have otherwise paid the same price or cheaper for a better hotel that included breakfast and parking. The HDMI connection did not work in the bedroom area so we could comfortably watch movies while laying down. Technical support was a maintenance person who had no technical knowledge, so he was useless. We asked for a room switch with a working HDMI connection, he said we'd get a call, never got a call, never got a room switch. No balcony either, windows only open a couple inches. Water pressure was not good in the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service need to be more customer focused.
review.locationRemarks: Only a limited number or restaurants deliver to this hotel so ordering anything other than the restaurant downstairs was out of the question.

review.title: Nice stay for prior flight out.
review.reviewText: There was some banging around late night but not to bad. I think there are a lot of out of town workers there, but again no problem.

review.title: Aceptable
review.reviewText: Overall good hotel except that we found a bug on our bed , maybe they can fumigate more often

review.title: Disappointing for the boatload of money we paid!
review.reviewText: We Love Expedia, but this was a huge Fail and we won't stay here again! Seriously, the only pleasant part of our stay for both weekends was that our car seemed to be relatively safe (for an additional $10.95 per day fee) in their parking lot while we travelled internationally. The staff was friendly, but truly a bit clueless about items in our room not working. Hotel needs major upgrades, especially the rooms. Clearly, not worth $170 per night and without a pool, hot tub or continental breakfast... Yikes!!!

review.title: Better business center
review.reviewText:
needed a better business center and computer capabilities
elevators run down and noisy
rooms nice general ambiance friendly

review.title: Nice hotel VERY near SFO - convenient!!!
review.reviewText: Not a 5 star hotel, but just your basic, clean, well appointed overnight hotel....having a restaurant, Houlihan's, on the property was a wonderful treat. Not only a full bar but a wide array of appetizers and entrees. The big test was the fried calamari appetizer; not a chewy piece in the bunch....also loved the goat cheese bruschetta; yummy!!! All in all, a perfect fit for a quick overnight stay!!!

review.title: Convenient to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Clean. Nicely furnished. Should include smaller pillow in choices. (All were too bulky.) Fitted sheet and mattress cover repeatedly popped off the mattress. ( Were appropriate for a thinner mattress.)
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO airport

review.title: Last minute stay
review.reviewText: I had to organise last minute hotel as my flight was rerouted. Arrived at midnight, left at 7am next morning and eeded a hotel between flights, for short sleep and shower. Friendly helpful reception. Room and bathroom were clean (though there was a faint cigarette smoke smell), room decor was updated (bit of a surprise as rest of hotel was old. Hotel rate was high ($245 on Expedia) but guess that's what you get at last minute. All other hotels were sold out. Fine for that brief stay. Shuttle bus to airport was very useful.

review.title: very nice n clean
review.reviewText: best handicap roon we've been in. but needed continental breakfast. with a bar in the hotel, there were not enough parking spaces for hotel guests. worried bout getting vehical dented by a intoxicated person.
review.locationRemarks: was close to the freeway made things easy to get to

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Loved that they offered free shuttle service to the airport and the Bart station. The restaurant inside the hotel didn't offer good service. The waiters were slow, forgot my order and only came back to the table once to check on us.

review.title: Nice hotel convenient to airport and city.
review.reviewText: I stayed with my wife for a training being hosted at the hotel. The hotel was next to the highway but reasonably quiet, and very convenient to the airport and San Francisco, once I understood the directions. Exits are poorly marked and not numbered on Highway 101, which made it a little confusing at first. The room was comfortable and the staff were pleasant. Parking was not unreasonable, and wi-fi was free, which I appreciated. Hotel restaurant was not bad.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in was slow. The front desk seemed small and understaffed for the size of the hotel.

review.title: Does not have a cancellation policy
review.reviewText: Business travelers bever. This hotel doesn't have a cancellation policy and will charge you for the entire stay before you arrive. Do Not make reservations in that hotel.
review.locationRemarks: not important

review.title: Nice hotel, close to airport & restaurants
review.reviewText:
Also, they have a sports bar on the main floor - which is perfect since I was there Sat/Sun during football.

There was a problem with getting a channel with a game I wanted to see and they had it fixed within 15 minutes when I told them kickoff was in an hour and I didn't want to miss it. Very accommodating in general.

review.title: Convenient if business need to stay near airport
review.reviewText: If you have business near SFO, this is a clean and convenient place nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing really within walking distance

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel. Really nice rooms and beautiful lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Really close to the highway and ihop and near a gas statio

review.title: It's close to the Airport, but...
review.reviewText:
It is the worst hotel I've stayed at for that price. Anywhere else in the country, that level hotel would be considered a MOTEL, not a HOTEL. Basically the whole entire hotel is run down, old, dirty. The staff are like zombies, just there and no friendly greetings what so ever. I asked if the room had a fridge, and the guy said "I think the rooms in that level should have one". Ok, if I go up there and it is simply not there, I can deal with that but there was a cabinet where the fridge was "supposed to be" but it was empty, holes for all the wiring and drains but NO FRIDGE. Not that I really needed one, although I was planing on using it, but it is the whole principal. Bathrooms are run down, dirty, just "BLAH".

Long story short, it's not the worst place I've stayed at, but just not worth the $$$.
review.negativeRemarks: OMG... Doors/Locks: needs to be replaced! Walls: need to be re-painted! Bathroom: needs to be re-done! Fridge: go buy one and install it!
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport so that was great... actually, that's the only thing to do around there.

review.title: Optimal hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: Clean room, nice dcor, big desk. The WiFi is very weak at peak hours in the evening and the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport, regular shuttle service. Has a decent restaurant on the premises.

review.title: Comfortable Room, but this Hotel is a Mixed Bag
review.reviewText:
So they have room service, but the in-house restaurant is pretty awful - Houlihan's. Like a chain restaurant that also doubles as a place where a collection of happy hour riff raff likes to assemble and get completely wasted - this is what greets you upon arrival. While I was trying to check in - a process that took about 15 minutes - one of the staff was trying to call the police about a guests car that had been broken into.

Right, so.... it's a good hotel. But it is also just on the borderline of being an awful hotel. It's the kind of place that has security issues and while it does cater to a business clientele, when you walk to your room you also get the sense that this hotel has an identity problem. Although not as scary or ghetto as other hotels close by (say in San Bruno), this hotel isn't one I'd recommend for single female travelers or families. It's coarse.
review.positiveRemarks: The fact that it had room service and the proximity to the airport are the only good things I have to say.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the facilities overall. Security - although the hotel has little control over the fact that it is in close proximity to crime.
review.locationRemarks: Work, fly, and Eat.

review.title: GOOD
review.reviewText: good location , but charged for PARKING that was too disgusting , $10/DAY, TOO CHEAP OR GREEDY, and on the last day bed frame was broken , don't even call them , because at 11 pm this happen , we have to leave 3.30 am - so we adjusted . if there is a - next time - this hotel out from our choice

review.title: Convenient location to Airport
review.reviewText: very close to airport with nice rooms, bar, and friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: close to airport (SFO)

review.title: good
review.reviewText: it is better than I expect. It is comfort and it is safe

review.title: Convenient, a bit dated, weak staff
review.reviewText: The room was fine, but the bathroom was dated and cheap. Tub/shower especially dated and old. We were not told about the parking fee when we made reservations, and desk staff were very dismissive. The location is very convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Identify Ann charges when making reservations. Upgrade the tub and shower units.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport, which was our objective.

review.title: Decent and convenient.
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice and helpful. My only problem was calling desk service for something and they would get unintelligible and mumble if it was something they really couldn't provide or do.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and distance from the airport. The shuttle that runs to and from the airport is convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: A regular shuttle to the city --asking for a lot, but I would be happy to pay $20 each way -- a taxi is expensive. The mixed drinks are weak.
review.locationRemarks: The city of course. You may want to rent a car. Getting a ride into the city will cost between 40 - 50 dollars for a taxi.

review.title: hotel stay
review.reviewText: the hotel was clean in a nice location far away from the big city and close enough to drive the hotel was clean the staff was great Houligans was nice enough to eat a great dinner and coffee and breakfast was wonderful -- I would stay here again!!!
review.locationRemarks: houligahns on property was wonderful

review.title: Nice updated hotel with great Hwy 101 access
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant stay with nice accommodations in a great, easily accessible from Hwy 101

review.title: nice hotel,nice furniture
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel everything is nice, but only the problem for me was the poor internet and we really need it and other thing was the smilled of cigarette.
review.locationRemarks: well everything was far

review.title: Nice hotel, close to airport & downtown
review.reviewText:
Wanted to spend the weekend in San Fran for the first time but did not want to pay the astronomical prices of downtown hotels/motels. Place is nice, staff is friendly and Houlihan's restaurant in lobby is great! Love the Quesadillas!!!

Parking was 10$ per night, which i didnt like but everything else was good.

Negative- TV signal was very bad. Kept going in/out...
review.positiveRemarks: Everything except the TV signal and parking...
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking and MORE parking! Make the Houlihan's visitors pay, not the hotel guests...
review.locationRemarks: Nothing within a SAFE walking distance because neighborhood looks kind of dark but, if you have a car, jump on the 101 and you can go anywhere...

review.title: Nice and clean.
review.reviewText: Excellent! Will recommend to anyone. Hotel was clean and peaceful. Food was excellent too.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenience

review.title: Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed here numerous times but this last time was my worst experience... Hotel has seen better days, staff is grumpy. No breakfast is offered for your stay, and the in-house restaurant is overpriced and serving staff is unprofessional.

review.title: Hotel Below Average / Staff nice!
review.reviewText: The rooms are old and dated. Mine had a moldy smell and the AC barely worked. Furnished nicely and comfortable. Room condition was below average.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff. Convent to conference center.
review.negativeRemarks: Repair and update the condition of the room; walls, floor and fixtures.
review.locationRemarks: Not much!

review.title: meh
review.reviewText:
Charge to park in a regular lot $10 a day
staff is rude
bathrooms small and left out of date
no pool
hallways smell like dirty carpet
tried to add on charges for movies I didn't see, called front desk was able to get charge off but very shady check your paperwork before checkout
only plus really is comfy beds, i will not deny them that
review.negativeRemarks: staff was rude and the bathroom decor was outdated and charging for parking rip off
review.locationRemarks: right of the exit headed up to san fran so good access

review.title: Just OK. Rooms are not very comfortable
review.reviewText: I choose the Holiday Inn due a long delay in my flight through SFO. The Price is not cheap, maybe I expected more due it, however now I know that in general prices in SFO are quite high.
review.positiveRemarks: The shuttle bus is pretty convenient to connect the airport and hotel back and fwd, it runs every 30 min. Staff is friendly and effective.
review.negativeRemarks: When someone opens the shower or closes a door you hear it as in your own room. Curtains in the room don't close completely, too much morning light
review.locationRemarks: Location is OK if you want to be in touch with the airport. Time to SFO down town using the shuttle and BART is 1hr approx. Nothing to do around.

review.title: Its not bad.
review.reviewText:
We had to find a place to stay after our flight was canceled as a result of the plane crash in San Francisco. I booked through Expedia and got a decent rate. Being from Texas, I was not used to the costs of the west coast and everything is much more expensive. The room was clean, and reasonably comfortable. The room had a king bed and a sleeper sofa, as well as a chaise lounge so there was plenty of room to lay down for me, my wife and son. The attached restaurant is also just ok. It is overpriced to be sure, but the food is decent. The hotel didn't have much in the way of amenities (no pool, weight room was not very good etc). Don't expect much in the way of things to do near the hotel either. It is in south San Francisco near the airport, which is not "San Francisco" that everyone thinks about. The very best part of the hotel is the staff, who were very helpful and polite to my stranded family.

I was happy to have a place to stay for 2 days until my replacement flight.
review.locationRemarks: Not much. Take the shuttle to the airport and then BART to downtown.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: It was a one-night visit. We needed a nice room and we got it at a reasonable price.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy to find; on-time airport shuttle service; great restaurant on premises
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting in lobby could be brightened (seemed a bit dark)
review.locationRemarks: We did not wander outside the hotel once we arrived. We stayed there for convenience for our morning flight.

review.title: South San Fran Holiday Inn
review.reviewText: I expected more from a Hotel, it was old, carpet was old too. I wouldn't recommend, stay at the Holiday Inn Express
review.positiveRemarks: Staff at the bar/rest and front desk were really nice

review.title: Possibly unsafe
review.reviewText: We were disappointed by the room and the restaurant food was poor. The was $15 charge for a basic breakfast, while bottled water was $4. We felt unsafe and noticed out of place people in the lobby and were repeatedly asked for our room number by the restaurant staff even though we were paying with cash...odd to say the least. Then there were 2 cars screeching thru the hotel parking lot going the wrong way, shortly after which a police car arrived and the officer went into the hotel lobby. The front desk did not answer the phone.
review.negativeRemarks: We felt our security to be in jeapordy
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO

review.title: Feedback
review.reviewText:
The photos displayed on Expedia are very miss leading
The hotel staff do not have any common sense. When I
Checked in the staff didn't even tell me which level my room was on
On arrival I requested assistance with our bags we were given a trolley the assistant that was suppose to help us watched us load our bags ourself.
We requested a refrigerator as there was not one in the refridgerator on arrival.
The same guy that was suppose to assist us with our luggage bought the refrigerator and violently threw it in the refrigerator cabinet.
To top it off I was charged for parking at this dreadful hotel
I wasted money on accommodation at this so called hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: We checked in to be near the airport. Easy to find and less than 5 min away. Had a nice stay and a great breakfast. Overall enjoyed the 1 night !
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport and reasonably priced. Comfortable beds and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The TV had problems working, was resolved after 1hour. Parking should be free.
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown SF and surrounding areas.

review.title: good for the money
review.reviewText: You're getting what you paid for but nothing less! Quality on a budget. Surprisingly low airport and highway noise.
review.locationRemarks: close to SFO and highway

review.title: Typical airport hotel.
review.reviewText: Rooms have been updated and the restaurant was average. Transportation to and from airport was excellent. This was the smallest bathroom I've seen in a while. Overall, it was an average airport hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Less noise than I expected.

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: We had great stay, the rates were good and the hotel was very nice. we will definitely stay again when we are in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: the location was convenient, 15 to 20 mins from pier 39
review.negativeRemarks: nothing really, maybe the planes in the morning, but that is to be expected at the airport location.
review.locationRemarks: about 20 mins from pier 39 by the airport, there is also a great chinese buffet next door.

review.title: Don't go unless trying the worst hotel quality
review.reviewText:
The receptioist wasn't able to find my reservation, using my name.
She said I didn't have the reservation. Only after I showed the confirm number,
she found it, w/o any sorry about her neglect of entering my name properly,
after 5 minutes of hustle.

Then the room was stinky, crapet was too dirty to step on bare foot.
The sheet and linen were similar condition - looks like they used same
sheet for multiple days for multiple customers.

Then their bar/restraunt service is no exception - horrible shape w/
unfriendly bar tender.

review.title: OK hotel for the money.
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice. The lobby was always full of events from weddings to private parties, etc. The hallways needed some attention as the carpeting was full of dirt and debris. The rooms were ok, nothing special.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport. There is a Denny's down the street and a Hertz Car rental within walking distance.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText:
Clean rooms, near airport. The area is a bit desolate but the hotel experience is good overall. Could have included complementary breakfast for the room rent they charged (They also charged for parking).

But good upkeep, prompt service.
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport, clean and tidy rooms, good upkeep
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.title: Great Hotel to make connecting flights
review.reviewText: Easy access to Airport and Rental Car agencies, Clean and good restaurant service
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: not recommended
