review.title: Great travel Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and staff very friendly. I also loved we were close to the airport. Perfect for traveling. We left our car for the week, but know that it is $10 a day.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, rooms were new, bedding nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell of the cleaning supplies. Very strong in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Airport

review.title: Great Value for Great Service
review.reviewText: Excellent service, the hotel staff really cared about our comfort and the manager went out of his way to ensure that we got the most out of our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Located near SFO, great value.

review.title: Avoidit
review.reviewText:
Hotel smelled of sewage and air fresher. Paying for parking a joke.
never again.

review.title: Tired traveler
review.reviewText:
The hotel shuttle from SFO was dreadfull - I waited 45 min.,while other hotel shuttles kept circling, finally had to call and wait another 15 min. the driver was surly and not helpful with my luggage, I had come from a 12 hr. flight and anxious to check in and recover.
I have stayed in other hotels in this area, some cheaper and had better service.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText:
The Bar is very nice but the staff is very unfriendly with the exception of the gentlemen who served me breakfast and one of the bar keepers. I never received the discount for the happy hour and the they tried to overcharge me.

The room was clean but paint is pealing of the closet, bath tub etc.

The front office and hotel staff is very friendly

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: The hotel and the staff were nice. The room was pretty clean, seems kinda old. Almost thought I could smell mold throughout the hallways but not sure. It was close to the airport but quite a ways from downtown San Fransisco.

review.title: Quality hotel near Airport.
review.reviewText: I flew up last minute for nlcs. Got in at 1230 and room wasn't ready. Which didn't bother me a bit cause check in was a 3. So they held my bag until after the game. I didn't check in.until 1030 that night. Room was clean and bed was comfy. Went to the hotel bar and had a drink and retired for the evening. Bar served until midnight and food iirc until 11. If you don't want to rent a car they have the shuttle to take you back to the airport to take the Bart. Which takes you downtown in about 30 min and you can transfer to other places. No free breakfast which the no limit on shuttle rides makes up for.
review.positiveRemarks: Bar on property. Close to airport and Bart.
review.negativeRemarks: The small step coming out of my bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Nothing special. By the airport. So gas station and other hotels around

review.title: hotel SUCKS!!!
review.reviewText: staff is horrible, disrespectful and would never recomend this hotel to any one. we had to change hotels because how rude there staff was!!!

review.title: Good location and services
review.reviewText: The cost is pricey but it's close to the airport, you have4 airport pickup, and it has a bar and restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and a shopping center is near by.

review.title: Not worth the money they charge
review.reviewText: This hotel didn't live up to holidayInn experiences I come across at other sites.

review.title: Great for business stay
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet and comfortable. Very nice on premise restaurant and bar. Convenient parking and access to freeways.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Not too bad! Need to call ahead and make sure any request are going to be met. After a small issue with first room. we were moved to another room and all was good

review.title: Comfort without the high price
review.reviewText: Beds are comfortable and clean. Bathroom is very compact, with barely enough space for the toilet and a shower over the bathtub. The room air conditioning wasn't cool enough for the summer and the fan setting was only sufficient to circulate the air, not necessarily the cool air. There is also an $11 charge per night for parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Close enough to where we want to be.

review.title: Very cool... nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: Loved my stay - it was great! I would recommend this hotel highly.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great access to everything...

review.title: Great hotel if you don't have a vehicle
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel. The room was clean and nice. I just did not like that we had to pay for parking. All the Hotels I've ever been to offer complimentary parking for free.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the Airport but not in Daly City

review.title: Good location for accessing the sites of The City
review.reviewText: Use the BART to access San Francisco.Hotel offers regular (every 30 mins) free shuttle from hotel to airport for BART connection (30 mins to central SAn Francisco).

review.title: Great location (by SFO and downtown S.F.)
review.reviewText: Only issue is that I had a non-smoking room and the last day I was there I could smell a bit of smoke in the room. I was told someone checked in next to my room who was found smoking and shouldn't have been. Otherwise would definitely stay here the next time I'm in town for business.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect - minutes from SFO, in the middle between downtown S.F. and southern points (San Jose, Cupertino, etc.)

review.title: Mediocre
review.reviewText:
I booked the hotel online and called the hotel front desk in person to make sure that we would have two beds in our room. Very disappointingly, when we got to the hotel at 11pm after a 10-hour exhausting flight, we still got a one king-bed room and were told that there was no two-bed room available anymore. The front desk agreed to send a roller bed to our room and promised to send the roller bed in 10 minutes so that we could rest and sleep asap. However, after more than 50 minutes and two calls to the front desk, they finally sent a roller bed to our room.

The condition was mediocre and the whole stay was disappointing.

review.title: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly
review.reviewText:
Overall OK.

On the positive side the location next to the airport is very convenient. Also the Houlihans in the hotel was very good and gives the place a lot more life than the typical airport hotel restaurant. The food and service at the restaurant were very good. The lobby is elegant and the bed comfortable

On the negative side I was shocked to be presented with a $10 fee for overnight parking. This is ridiculous for an airport hotel. It should be included in the price of the room. also the reception staff could have been friendlier. Also someone had left a luggage cart in the elevator, blocking everyone. Finally the reason I give a 3 for comfort is that the towels were really worn out. A lot more worn out than they should be given the overall quality of the room. Also one of the pillow cases was badly stained, it was not something you would want to use.

review.title: Perfact Location, with Great access to SFO Airport
review.reviewText: Perfact Location, with Great access to SFO Airport, Fisherman's Whorf, and other attractions. Only issue we had was that there was a Wedding in Hotel and ALL Parking was taken when I returned from downtown. Also charging for parking was un-expected for my travel experience.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
After check in, we went up to our room and under the beds are visible wrappers, it's not dirty but not properly vacuumed, before it was put out as clean and ready. The fridge in the room is not working. Front desk follows up every 10 minutes to find out if maintenance has been there. It was probably replaced hence the fridge shelvings was not placed in, when we came back.

Their "save the planet concern" should continue all the way to the bathroom. We hang our towels neatly, thinking of the same practice hotels do everywhere (hang it to reuse or floor to replace). The mega resorts in Vegas and hotels around the country and the world are doing it. Since housekeeping took our towels and forgot to put in new ones, we have to call for replacements. A minor inconvenience for a tourist, after a long day. But for a person with an early meeting the next day...think again.
review.locationRemarks: Sfo by airport. Very near the 101 freeway.

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: Room is clean and is sufficient for overnight stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Distance from airport. Free ride to and from airport

review.title: Good night
review.reviewText: We arrived at 10am and the staff was helpful to get us a room before the checkin hour. Comfort bed we got and what we needed.

review.title: This hotel can use some renovation
review.reviewText: The elevator we were trying to take to our room was out of order. The air conditioning in the room did not work and the front desk had to send a maintenance person to fix it. The bathroom needed to be painted and the door replaced. Window was dirty and somone wrote their name on the dust film. Bed appeared to be clean but had a lot of dust on the top cover.Overall very disappointed with the room condition.

review.title: that was excelent
review.reviewText: the hotel is big and confortable, and we got everything we need

review.title: San Francisco Holiday Inn Airport
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel for a short-term stay. For a long-term stay in San Francisco with resort amenities you would want another property.

review.title: very nice stay
review.reviewText:
very impressed with the room and hotel overall.

the only negative i have is the $10/day charge for parking.
review.locationRemarks: right by the airport

review.title: Can not provide rooms timely
review.reviewText: When we arrive the hotel,No room give us. until 3.PM, We get our rooms

review.title: STAY AT THE HOLIDAY INN
review.reviewText: NICE SERVICE. STAFF WAS VERY COOPERATIVE AND EASY TO TALK TO
review.locationRemarks: SOCAL

review.title: Hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: Everything was satisfactory. However, the air conditioning unit was not working despite the repairs made by the utility guy.
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: You can do better for your money
review.reviewText: I don't recommend this hotel. It's old and the maintenence is not kept up well at all. When we arrived in our room the remote didn't work for the TV, the water in the shower took 15 minutes to warm up and another ten if you needed to adjust the temp, the wallpaper was peeling and mold was growing in the corners of the shower, the hairdryer didn't work, and the room smelled of cigarettes, I was in a non-smoking room. I had to catch a morning flight when all of these things went wrong. Not good.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: I really liked this Hotel, not too far from everything.

review.title: A Great Visit
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the friendly helpful front desk staff and the cleaning staff was great. We would have no problem revisiting this hotel.

review.title: Fix the elevator
review.reviewText: Everything was great and everything you want or need out of an airport hotel. the only things that brought the rating down at all was the funky elevator.

review.title: I was satisfied with this place.
review.reviewText: It was a good place to stay. Only issue remotely displeasing was the sound of aircraft flying overhead, but that is beyond the control of the hotel. :)

review.title: Hotel NEEDS a lot of improvements!!!!!!
review.reviewText: My wife and I booked a 6 night stay at this hotel. When we checked in, the front desk representative was not too friendly and was very short with us. My wife had asked if there were any executive suites available due to the fact that we are a Priority Club Members. It is understandable that there were not any executive rooms available but the way we were talked to was not pleasent. The next day, we were able to move to an executive suite, room 431. First issue, the refrigerator did not work at all. We found that out by leaving drinks in the morning and came back in the evening with hot drinks. The next day, it was a little chilly and turned on the heater. Found out that did not work also. Both deficiencies were repaired. There was one front desk representative that gave us a free breakfast at Houlihan's for our troubles. That was very much appreciated. Throught out our stay in this hotel, there was always a very unpleasant smell in the hallways. The last day of our stay, it smelled like rotten fish by the elevator. The day we checked out, we were charged over $100 for parking. Parking? We never had stayed in a hotel or motel that required to pay for parking. The front desk representative pointed out to us that there were parking by the front of the hotel. We were unaware of that and explained to him that the whole stay in that hotel, we had to search for parking every night and actually had to park far away from the hotel. Hotel needs to be removed from Priority Club list.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good location, Houlihan's Restaurant, and modern furniture in the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff service, very, very poor parking and parking charge, unpleasant smell in the hallways, issues with the executive suite.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. Near the airport and areas we needed to go to.

review.title: robbery on the phone
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine although was utterly shocked to be presented with a bill for $96 for an international call lasting less than 10 minutes. There can be no justification for this kind of charge and it is daylight robbery. If hotels are going to charge such punitive rates they should do this with complete transparency and give examples of the cost of cals using the room phone.

review.title: Not worth the price.
review.reviewText:
Hotel needs significant work. Chairs in room are old/dirty. Towels were torn and old.

Hotel lacks cleaniness. I beleive this hotel is overpriced for what it has to offer. It is just close to long term parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Towels and chairs were old and torn.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for parking close to long term parking.

review.title: Goood hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is good and clean. They only problem with this hotel was the late response from the desk for your needs. It took them 45 minutes to get us a knife.
review.locationRemarks: Not bad. Great for travelers.

review.title: Comfy and convenient
review.reviewText: Your basic stay-close-to-the-airport hotel. Shuttle to SFO was convenient and on time.

review.title: Good business travel hotel
review.reviewText: There were some dated features to the hotel but for what I wanted it was the perfect hotel. I good inexpensive place to stay on business travel. The staff was extremely helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Good close to my clients.

review.title: TERRIBLY NOISY and UNCOMFORTABLE
review.reviewText:
Extremely difficult to find on the airport area. Staff is just "nice", no more.
Room are HORRENDOUSLY noisy: close to road, to US-101, and heating is like being close to plane propellers!!! It's be warm and don't sleep or freeze and sleep... And it's a "stop and go" system: heat up and freeze, and all the way around again. WIth the propellers noise coming from the fan. Can't there be a normal radiator and heating system instead of this uncomfortable, unefficient and unuseful system? Come to Europe, we know how to make efficient heating systems that are completely silent.
Bathroom is ugly and uncomfortable.
Restaurant is NOISY at night, have to wait for a long time for orders. Unfriendly for breakfast.
Rather chose another hotel in SFO
review.negativeRemarks: NOISE from everywhere: restaurant, heating, road...
review.locationRemarks: Extremely difficult to find

review.title: Close to Rt 101 but not at all noisy!
review.reviewText: Excepting for the bath room everything about the hotel is nice experience. The standing bath makes the entire room wet and becomes messy.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant in the hotel and proximity to Rt 101

review.title: Convenient and that is that
review.reviewText: Very convenient for a late night arrival or early morning departure but not a lovely place to stay for longer.

review.title: no complaints - perfectly good
review.reviewText: A standard Holiday Inn - good shuttle service, comfortable pillows, helpful staff.

review.title: pleasant stay to see the GIANTS win!
review.reviewText: The room was very clean. a nice touch was the flat screen television and the free WiFi. The mini fridge was a definite bonus. Room service was exceptionally fast and courteous.
review.positiveRemarks: Very easy check in and check out. Bed was comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: No unfavorable things off the top of my head about the hotel. it was a pleasant stay.
review.locationRemarks: location was superb, exit the 101 and boom, you are there at the hotel.

review.title: Give it a try!
review.reviewText: Reasonably priced for a motel with shuttle service to SFO, and restaurant in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: 10 Minutes by shuttle from SFO

review.title: good
review.reviewText: overall a good experience...they need to update/modernize hotel bathroom in the room

review.title: On this stay not so good.
review.reviewText: The 1st night the air in the room blew hot air would no adjust. Opened the window and counted jets taking off.The 2nd night we returned to a dirty room after a Monday night 49er game. The maid service didn't clean my room. The manager did call and said he would make right. I have always had a good stay here. But on this occasion it was not good. However the staff is great and I will come back. Can't be mad, my 9ers won.

review.title: perfect for convention center
review.reviewText: great restaurant in hotel-Houlahans

review.title: Back From The Islands
review.reviewText: Mixed reviews about going to this hotel after reading previous posts. However, I was pleased. Room was clean and very comfortable. However, I did book a king size bed and ended with two doubles. Also our family were not next door, not big deal but still disappointing.

review.title: $7 parking fee and no parking spots available
review.reviewText: They charge a parking fee per day and twice we were unable to find a spot.

review.title: I would stay there again.
review.reviewText: We stayed there for a 49er's game. Received poor service at the bar/restaurant and would not go back there but we would stay at the Hotel again.

review.title: George Osborne
review.reviewText: We felt we should be given a free breakfast based on the price of the hotel.

review.title: Won't go back if I have other choice
review.reviewText: The hotel looks old and out dated in many details. Certain things have been upgraded, but there are a lot to do obviously. The biggest issue I had with them is that I have prepaid my stay in an upgraded room package. During the check-in, they never mentioned anything and just put me in a lower level room. Until I got in the room annoticed the difference and called them, then only they admitted that the room type I prepaid had been sold out. First time I run into this type of situation, terrible.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Gotta a very good deal! I recommend everyone to stay there.. parking is only 7 bucks.. Will definitely go back.

review.title: Served our purpose
review.reviewText: we were in a house hunting trip, so we only went to the hotel late at night. Location was OK to go south, north and east relatively easy.

review.title: Bad hotel, great guest manager
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights, 2 days. In that time, staff only cleaned the room once. We called and asked for fresh towels since they had not touched the room, and they sent up 1. There were 4 people in the hotel room. We then had an issue with the TV and called maintenance. It took maintenance 1 hour and 2 phone calls to show up. When they came, he only changed the remote and said he'd come back in 5 minutes to fix the rest. We waited awake for an additional hour and he never came back. When we called the front desk to complain, he was rude and very unhelpful. They didn't even offer to switch our room to a working TV. The ice machine on our floor was broken, the elevator was very fussy- sometimes needing a room key to switch floors, other times not, and there was no breakfast or free parking. Just when we thought the hotel was positively awful, we met Joey, the guest manager and complained. He was SO apologetic and unbelievably nice. He took off the extra charges to our room for parking and could not apologize enough. I wouldn't stay at this hotel or recommend it to anyone, but if you must stay, make sure Joey still works there to fix the mess the rest of the employees and services create.

review.title: Was there for a conference and it met all my needs
review.reviewText: My daughter was there for a conference and my grandson and I came along. We used room service and all of our special requests were met with no problems. Friendly and accomodating staff.

review.title: Andrew W
review.reviewText:
Hotel was very clean the staff were friendlly and attentive great location from the airport and easy access to major highways, room was well maiintain and
comfortable would recommend this hotel to a friend.
